profile.name: Ray
profile.bio: I make tools and technology for videogames development. Available for technical consulting, courses teaching and conferences. Feel free to message me!

analysis.career_trajectory: This developer has been working on various projects related to videogames programming, including game project templates, Lua libraries, C libraries for physics and graphics, and a comprehensive list of custom game engines. They have also contributed to the development of raylib, a popular videogames library, and have reviewed pull requests from other developers.

technical_obsessions.evidence: There is no direct evidence of database sharding in this developer's history. However, their experience with file system operations abstraction (e.g., `rres` and `GetDirectoryFileCount()`/`GetDirectoryFileCountEx()`) may be relevant to understanding the technical aspects of sharding.
The developer has worked on a simple and easy-to-use immediate-mode GUI library (raygui) and has reviewed pull requests related to GUI development (e.g., `rconpacker`)

comment_analytics.communication_style: This developer is known for being supportive and open to feedback, as evident from their responses to pull requests and issues raised by other developers.

match_profile.similar_user_traits: This developer is most similar to a user who is also interested in videogames programming, game development, and GUI development.
conversation_starters: What are some of the challenges you've faced while working on raylib?
How do you approach database sharding in your projects?
Can you share any experiences with immediate-mode GUI libraries?
